name: places/ChIJ41YkSQdZwokRshEQ-CT9prU
formattedAddress: 220 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
adrFormatAddress: 220 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA

originalText.text:
They were part of my insurance and I had seen decent reviews so got an appointment for a detailed eye check up here. The appointment started out OK but by the time it ended, I had a very different opinion of this place. Dr. Naysan and the technician Josh, were the ones who attended to my appointment. While it started out trying to complete my examination, halfway through Josh received a call from another doctor about something completely not work related and left my appointment to go attend to wrapping up some items and mailing them to this doctor. I was not impressed by this lack of attention or leaving me in the middle of my examination. Dr. Naysan went over the reports and was not able to conclude with any certainty on the results, and phrases like ‘ It’s not that I don’t believe you’ or ‘you seem old, but not old enough‘ rapidly decreased my degree of confidence in his findings.
When a doctor mentions that some equipment for an exam has been broken for a while so they can’t use it for a patient, your confidence does plummet.
The biggest red flag for me was their unwillingness to part with a complete set of reports from my appointment, in spite of me requesting a full detailed set of all examination reports. There was a lot of back-and-forth and resistance and even after all that, I only received one single page of scans.
They were polite thought out so don’t get one star. Maybe that’s just the regular procedure or there’s some misfire in the delivery of information, but I walked away from this appointment not confident at all in the inconclusive diagnosis or next steps.

originalText.text:
AVOID AT ALL COSTS - INSURANCE FRAUD, WRONG PRESCRIPTIONS, AND UNRESPONSIVE ADMINS. Someone needs to investigate or audit this place.
I came in for my annual eye exam and prescription update, and during the first appointment Dr. Shah was unable to find the right setting to fully correct my vision (I have a very mild prescription, too - less than 2.00 in both eyes). She spent about 45 seconds getting the phoropter machine as close as she could, then wrote a prescription for glasses and told me to wear them for two weeks then return for corrections which is when she would perform the eye health check. I asked why I wasn't able to see through the machine like I always can, and she gaslit me into believing that my eyes were just tired and needed to relax which is where the prescription would help. When I got the glasses the prescription was so wrong I couldn't even look through them.

At the next appointment, Dr. Shah immediately dilated my eyes for an eye health check (where no issue was found) but I told her I couldn't see anything with the glasses. She tried for about a minute to find the right the prescription, but I told her I still couldn't see anything and again asked why we weren't able to use the phoropter to find the right prescription. She wrote another Rx, again gaslighting me into believing that I wouldn't be able to see well out of both eyes. At this point I got suspicious, so I went to Warby Parker where the wonderful doctor there was able to dial in my prescription in no more than 10 minutes and I could see perfectly again.

A month later, I got a bill for $90 from Rosenblum. They had billed my health insurance for the eye health check that should have gone to my vision insurance. I called dozens of times to get them to correct it, and every time was told by reception that Lola (the office manager) would get back to me but I never received a call back. The one time I was able to connect with her directly, she tried to claim that my vision insurance doesn't cover the annual eye health check, even though I have screenshots of the benefits confirming it does and confirmed it with the company several times over the phone. I am about to enter a legal battle with them because they're completely ignoring my calls to correct the charge. Sounds like someone else on here has had the exact same experience unfortunately.

Save yourself the time and headache and go elsewhere!

originalText.text: I have been a patient for many years but I think it is time to find another place.   The Center has many good doctors including Dr. Rosenblum, but nobody is managing the shop.  Most inefficient place I can think of and you can easily waste half a day there.  There is chronic disorganization and the staff that are good are understandably frustrated.  Dr. Rosenblum should either hire a good office manager or close the operation.

Dr. Rosenblum should either hire a good office manager or close the operation.

originalText.text: The people at this office are so professional and understanding! The Doctors have always been incredible. Dr. Shah explained things incredibly and really took the time to make sure I was comfortable and answered all of my questions. I wouldn’t go anywhere else for my ophthalmology needs!

text.text: The people at this office are so professional and understanding! The Doctors have always been incredible. Dr. Shah explained things incredibly and really took the time to make sure I was comfortable and answered all of my questions. I wouldn’t go anywhere else for my ophthalmology needs!

originalText.text: This was my first time at Rosenblum Eye Centers (Forest Hills, Queens location). My appointment was at 9:45am and I was seen within 10 minutes of finishing up my registration paperwork. The women at the front desk were very kind and helpful (one lady stayed on the phone with me while I looked for the office since it was difficult to locate due to heavy construction in the area.) Dr. Rosenblum was polite, funny, listened to me and explained eye related issues in detail. He made me feel comfortable and did a complete eye examination on me. I would definitely recommend this place! FYI: just try to give yourself ample time to look for parking if you are driving there...Queens Blvd is no joke lol
